1RDmZMl_jARQWOqp_aH3-w.text: The external decor of this place really gives me the creeps! There's a picture of an archetypal 1950s woman leering over her husband at you - wtf?!  Once you get inside it's clear that they're going for the homely feel, but the tongue-in-cheek manner of it just gives me the shivers for some reason. The food, however, is amazing with all the classic British staples like steak pie, fish of the day with chips, haggis and roast chicken.  It's all priced as you would expect with most mains costing about 8 and it all looks and tastes great.  I had their chicken pie which was served in a filling portion, and certainly gave me value for money with plenty of tender chunks of chicken and vegetables in a delicious gravy. I definitely recommend this place for great food and quick service.

photos.caption: Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

PfaV2oldxy353l19wMADLA.text: Oh how I love Monster Mash! It serves the most amazing British comfort food with a slight 70's feel to it.   Situated just around the corner from the main University campus, George Square, Monster Mash is super popular with all the students at lunch and dinner time so it can be difficult to get a seat.   The menu offers a mouth watering selection of British classic meals which completely do the trick when you are cold and hungry and walking around Edinburgh on a miserable day. Monster Mash's menu includes dishes such as haggis, fish and chips, Shepard's pie, steak pie, and my absolute favourite, roast chicken with ALL the trimmings - yum!  They also serve a really gorgeous pasta dish with a tomato and onion sauce which never fails to impress.   Monster Mash also serve breakfast meals including a full fry up, eggs Benedict and really tasty breakfast rolls which just cost 1.50 - what a bargain! Mt friend absolutely loves their coke floats (coke with ice cream) and I can't seem to get enough of their strawberry milkshakes - they are just so yummy.   I cannot recommend Monster Mash any higher, I love it!

photos.caption: Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

Mcr2PpKA69SyApnBb70pPw.text: Mums was a great experience for a tourist!   The service is fantastic - the servers are soo friendly! And the best part of course, is that the food is fantastic and the lunches (5 pounds) are such a good deal!   The lunch comes with a soup and a main. I had the macaroni and cheese, with the tomato soup. It was filling, and delicious comfort food. I also had the genius to get the milkshake marked as "AMAZING" on the menu, the gingerbread. Seriously it was amazing. If you go to Mums, you should check out this milkshake.   My more daring friend decided to try the meat Haggis, and though it was scary, it ended up being delicious (sort of like.. more flavorful ground beef) so if you want to try it in a less intimidating environment, I recommend Mums!   As someone who came to the UK fearing high prices, Mums is definitely a pleasant (and delicious) experience.

jpTGfDiX57vH4UtcxOb3GA.text: It's hard to review this place without getting hungry all over again... It certainly fulfills its description of itself as a 'British retro cafe', but its not retro in the sense of musty and weird, it's retro in the sense of it's that amazing it will honestly never ever go out of fashion.  They do have some none bangers-and-mash based things on their menu, like fish & chips or haggis, neeps & tatties, but for the most part the idea is pretty simple: You choose what type of sausage you want, how many sausages you want, and what flavour mash you want. If you're feeling healthy you can opt for a portion of veg one the side, but that'll cost you extra.  Speaking of prices, at first when my flatmate and I saw the menu we thought it was a bit steep - surely it shouldn't cost 6.95 for one single sausage and a dollop of mash?! But then the food arrived and we'd felt bad for ever thinking anything bad about this place...  The sausages were huge, for one thing. In fact, my flatmate couldn't even finish hers. My personal favourite would have to be the smoked pork and bacon one, but if it that doesn't appeal to you there were about 30 different types to choose from. The cajun mash was definitely a good choice too (although there was easily enough of it to feed 3 of me!), it wasn't too spicy but the waiter's description of it having "just a nice bit of heat" was spot on. For gravy I went for the garlic and herb one - call me boring but I didn't really know what was best to go with the range of flavours already on my plate!  If you are feeling ridiculously hungry, you can upgrade to 2 sausages and mash for 8.95, but I think I'll stik to trying to just finish the one first. If you're indecisive, don't worry. The staff were so patient and helpful, presumably because they're used to people taking ages to make their minds up from all the millions of combinations available.  It's fresh, it's filling, it's tasty and it's great value for money. If you've not been there already you should be ashamed of yourself.

photos.caption: Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

QXguiJ4vVMuVu8njd3aS_w.text: Came a few times this past summer when visiting friends for the fringe festival.  Casual and comfortable restaurant with great service and food!

hHICqi41qXlUouYuvi8Z4w.text: Good food at a reasonable price. We had the bangers and mash, haggis and date pudding, all were really good. The service was friendly  attentive and entertaining.

4ryDEvI7IH0RoS9nbbRvFA.text: Banter, banter with bangers and mash.  Oh, joy.   What does my head in every single time is that these people hit my funny bone seemingly without effort. I like to think that I laugh the calories away at the same pace that I'm eating them, at this here lovely establishment.  Its 70s wallpaper looks like it's hallucinating worse than you did during your presumably rather rough Saturday night, and the staff'll be relentless about your obvious hangover, but man, the food. The Foooooooood.  It's so good. It's like a giant hug, but then your stomach gets hugged too, and you feel this weird kind of incestuous no wait, intestuous hugging going on which makes you way to happy, in all the wrong kinds of ways.  Damn you Mums. Damn you for introducing me to your comfort food. And be double-damned for me not being able to stay away.  Breakfast at Tiffany's? Eat your heart out, (erm, yes arteries be damned!)  P.s. Vanilla shake, will you marry me?

96OdDYNJXx1HsvUL_rybMA.text: Mums--So fun!!!!! Great food. Great service. A lovely dry wit waitress. Made us laugh loads. Left us to ourselves.  The wine was divine. I ended up having two "holiday" size. Large :). Can't wait to go again!!!

VKr7hjDJ6byLcFvZnflsIg.text: We went here at lunchtime today and had a fabulous feed - and they served us lunch even though we turned up at what was really still breakfast time. I've never had a duff meal in Mum's - everything is just simple and delicious and spot-on. You want sausages and mash? Macaroni cheese? Fish pie? They all taste like my Mum's hiding round the corner cooking for me... Oh, and note - they do do booze! I note that the listing says they don't, but they do, including scrumptious ginger cider.

LgLc3kqjOOQHDRX7Tu9tpw.text: Best Bangers & Mash Ive ever had! I'm from the States but everytime I'm in Edinburgh I'll be right here eating these Bangers & Mash. So much fun combining all the bangers, the mashes and the gravies. Ate here at least a dozen times while I was there for five weeks last summer. Amazing.

n7bk5IFOfO1oH9J9MJbzFQ.text: Didn't know Haggis was comfort food.   After mustering up the courage to try it for myself, I was comforted to know that the MUM's recipe I was served contained nothing but ground veggies, bean bits and barley parts, piled high on top of parsnip and carrot mash. (I did order the meaty Haggis, but wasn't going to send this tower of yum back to the kitchen.) The onion gravy was flavorful and the pumpkin-leek-potato soup served with sundried tomato bread was also yummy after I doused it in salt.   It's a 5 Pounds Sterling Lunch Special that's worth every pence. And the Irn Brew was like drinking liquid bubble gum. Yes, I felt about seven again with this Happy Meal. In fact, I even got a fruity chew with the tab, which was much better than some lead-based Chinese toy doomed to break after unwrapping it from the cellophane.  Next time, if I ever go back to Edinburgh, I'll order the Traditional Haggis in True Scottish fashion--in a skirt and no underwear or in underwear and no skirt, whichever one's more comfortable.

8haXhOy3xHJygGc1eCMPsg.text: The absolute best fish & chips I have ever had!  The bangers & mash were very good as well but the fish just stole the show.  The space is small and cute, very interesting-comfort/pub food in a unique atmosphere.  I found the place from a travel book and we were very pleased with our choice of dinner on our first night in Edinburgh.  I still dream about that fish....

TE3xpAweZBp5bQno2oUqkw.text: Soooo yummy!  Hubbo and I each got a cup of cappuccino, they came in a huge cup and tasted soooo good.  I opted for the 3 sausage, mash & gravy and he picked Shepherds Pie.  The garlic & ginger sausage was my favorite, but the Satan's Revenge and  the classic weren't bad either.  Hubbo's pie was also really tasty.  Great comfort food/diner restaurant with friendly service.  The server also chit chat with us about the food to the DSLR camera we were using.  Overall, a great dining experience and I'm a fan!

tZf1xyKaXdewLVn2B3kkvQ.text: My husband and I went to Mums while we were in Scotland, over a month ago! WE STILL TALK ABOUT IT. I wants me sum MUMS :) there is this waitress there that will sit down with you and discuss the foods and drinks and how they all pair, it seemed like her world and it was just LOVELY...best waitress ever.

PI4OjP3g4huOies_goKHsw.text: Unless you like heavily salted food, I wouldn't bother. How this place is rated so highly through TripAdvisor, I'll never know!   I had the Mushroom Wellington and a cup of tea. I received a small plate that was half "hand cut" chips and the other half was a pathetic bit of Iceberg lettuce with one slice of tomato, with a small tub of homemade coleslaw. The Wellington had been chucked on top of this, so as you can imagine, not the best presentation.   It took 8 or 9 mouthfuls of stodgy, salty, pastry to get to any sort of "filling" in the Wellington. Yes, as advertised, there was a mushroom, spinach and cheese filling, unfortunately, there was absolutely no taste to any of it. The "hand cut" chips, come heavily salted. So heavily, that you think they must have been salted before going into the fryer! The only thing on the plate that was halfway decent was the coleslaw.   Service was decent, when they weren't busy sprawled across the booths chatting to their mates. Tables were also far too cramped, both for getting into and the number of people expected to sit around them. Oh and you get two Fruit Salad chewy sweets with your bill.   It's fair to say that I won't be going back.

202qwOpzfo8p37Vt9XQ8ZQ.text: This cafe is a little off the Royal Mile stretch but if you like great Bangers and Mash, then it's worth you trekking over to get some. They have all sorts of bangers choices and also mash selection! We tried a variety of bangers and mashes and we were not disappointed, only disappointed that there isn't enough stomach to eat more!

sTDHlb7Jaqv2LkM7CGczeg.text: Mums, a fun place with great hearty food that will fill you to the brim.  Had the steak and ale pie, this thing was huge, the size of a small bus, very hearty and the flakey shell just dissolves in the thick rich graveyard of the pie. Oh yeah, imagine that. The restaurant has a very hip atmosphere with a staff that is very funny and friendly, makes you feel as you've been going there for years and not visiting.

3Be8XWB0FF8E2HmALC_SlQ.text: I was here last Wednesday sometime around lunch.  The portions are generous (I'm American, so you know I mean it), and one can't complain about the prices (especially for the rolls-- wow.)  The music was interesting (obscure 80's hits) and became a conversation starter between myself and my half-starved friend.  The waitress was great.  Love to return here.

53co9B8PhjN-SxVs97kokg.text: First I want to say that the people here are lovely! I was so looking forward to going after reading the reviews, but it was a disappointment.  I had, well...bangers and mash with gravy,  the bangers were ok, the mash was ok, but the gravy was a bit tasteless! how can that happen?? It's their thing, it's what they do! It should have been hot and tasty and comforting and scrummy..but it was just ok. My friend is a veggie and I felt for him, 2 skinny slightly burnt veggie sausages with that uninspiring gravy, it and he looked very sad. Our visit was during the festival so maybe just a bad night? anyway we wont be going back..a shame really, because it sounded like heaven.

atIpVA3Gqiw-jP34GHMelA.text: Indeed, this location is now called "Mum's Great Comfort Food", while the original Monster Mash has moved just down the street - same people, practically the same food, except you can get steak there now too. ....Steak!

nXOWvAXkqbp3VqeP9rFOwg.text: I am visiting Scotland for the week and visited Mums based on the yelp rating. It did not disappoint!! Huge steak pie, fresh out of the oven and flaky- perfection. I also had vegetarian sausage, carrots and broccoli, with mash and onion gravy. It was all delish. We topped it off with treacle which was warm from the oven with ice cream. Good portions and fresh ingredients. I would def recommend if you want to check out Scottish food

photos.caption: Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Now THIS is a steak pie!
Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Veggie sausage with potato mash and onion gravy

AC11xreWoommRrfAgcPfrA.text: Love the atmosphere very 60s! The food is warming and yummy, had the veggie haggis the portions are very big though and if you're not a True vegetarian you can have chicken gravy with your haggis! There's also a big selection of veggie sausages

photos.caption: Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Veggie haggis with not so veggie gravy
Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Awesome veggie haggis

vwj7z2UGW1sE70rsDmbt0g.text: Bring on the Albino Shouting Gorillas!  Like stepping back in time to somewhere around the 70's or 80's. Reminds me of school dinners but with good ingredients. In fact I'm sure those are the same style water jugs we had at my school back in the day.  Bangers and Mash are the order of the day here. And those snausages! OMG. Those snausages. Worth invading a small, unprepared, snausage-rich country for. But luckily they're made in the ole U of K so it's all good.  Portion was a little small. I had the two sausage and mash and I showed it who was boss in about three minutes.  The Shakes are truly awesome. And I like my milkshakes like I like my women, thick and rich.  I shall leave this review until I've had a chance to go back and try their Wagyu beef, 'cos I friggin' love Wagyu beef.  #montage to show the passing of time, pages falling off calendars, seasons changing, fade to black #  I had always lived with the belief that the cows that turn into Wagyu beef are fed on corn and beer and massaged daily.  I like the image of drunk cows saying things like "Yessh, good masharge, thish. Hic moo mooOOOooooOOooo hic"  Unfortunately Mums have printed a few 'home truths' about Wagyu beef on their menu and this has led to the crushing realisation that the image of drunken, massaged cows I had in my mind all these years is False. So screw you 'Mums', thanks for that.  But now I've had a Wagyu burger and OMFG it's good. Best burger ever, hands down.  They treat it with the respect it deserves. You can choose how to have it (have it rare or you are committing a crime) and it simply comes on a toasted bun, no sauce, no plastic cheese, just perfection. I'm getting all emotional thinking about it again.  I thought the chips that came with it weren't all that but then.......some of the burger juice dripped onto them and from then on they were awesome.  I want to be buried alive under an avalanche of Wagyu burgers and have to eat my way out.

photos.caption: Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Eggs Benedict ftw
Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Cup of tea....obviously.
Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Wagyu burger

d8G-MVFQnvA3qg25wFX2fg.text: Prior to my trip to Edinburgh, I had researched a few places to dine at that would offer vegetarian versions of typical Scottish fare. This place came up in my search and I was glad that I did since I quite enjoyed my meal here.  I came here a couple of weeks ago with an acquaintance. He had never been here either, despite having lived in Edinburgh all of his life. I had the vegetarian haggis neeps and tatties and he got the St. Giles steak and ale pie. Our food arrived promptly after we ordered and the portions were quite large. I've never had regular haggis before, so I can compare the vegetarian version to the actual version, but I will say that if regular haggis tastes like the version I had, I would probably like it. It was nicely seasoned, hearty, and just overall tasty. My dining partner quite liked his dish as well.  I like the pseudo-retro vibe that this place has and the food itself was quite good. Good value for your money. Definitely check this place out if you happen to have a quandary about where to dine in Edinburgh!

KM8qFaDORMvheHUC0zQ7kw.text: Extremely Poor Quality Food:  Came here because of the great reviews and was wanting something substantial for breakfast. My girlfriend and I ordered two plates of pancakes and one eggs Benedict. The pancakes were cold and had cold syrup poured over them - not to mention they were hardly fluffy and tasted as if they were made the night before. The eggs Benedict wasn't any better. The eggs hardly looked real and was coated in a sauce that is sure to upset the hardiest of stomachs. Overall if you're looking to spend the next two days running to the bathroom and a cramping stomach then this is your place. Oh, also the manager showed up 5-10 minutes after their scheduled opening time leaving a group of customers outside waiting to be let in.

QgzKPcO0F7RveilinBS3Xg.text: "vintage" restaurant with nice food and nice music (oldies), the sausages with mash won't disappoint you. Good place to taste the traditional British dishes with a bit of american influence. Maybe the service a bit slow from the perspective of a tourist who want to do every thing fast to see more, but anyway a good restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

oYBnAWNaeBtlCszrZNEdcQ.text: Had an awesome recovery breakfast here. Very extensive menu, but couldn't go past the bangers and mash. Sausages were tasty, with 6 or so types to choose from. The mash was so good, with so many options to choose from! Topped off with gravy, was a great start to the day. Nice relaxed atmosphere with cool music and fun, kitschy layout. Service was good too and waitress very friendly and helpful. Would definitely come again!

photos.caption: Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Pork &amp; leek and lamb &amp; mint sausage, with cheese and onion mash. Tasty!
Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Pork &amp; onion and lamb &amp; mint sausage, with mustard mash and onion gravy. Delicious!

4A3ZyhedlWSl4bezmHtwbA.text: Great place for breakfast! Incredibly friendly server whom really enjoyed talking to. Great lattes and divine scrambled eggs with smoked salmon on an English muffin. Just 18 for the lattes and 2 of the scrambles. Great place to fuel up for the day at a good price!

NT5z-lemssPJJbDiYa05-A.text: I have always avoided Mum's. I saw the picture of the mature student being fed traditional British food by a mother who clearly couldn't bear to let him go. I also imagined the stodgy bland food that awaited me inside. I shuddered at the thought... How wrong was I?  6.95 and I get veggie sausages, mash and gravy. There is a choice between broccoli and tomato and basil sausages, both are homemade. I choose one of each. There is a long mash menu, offerings including Moroccan spiced, tomato and basil and cheese and onion. I opted for courgette and garlic mash. Next comes gravy-there are two veggie options alongside the traditional meat gravy: tomato and thyme and red onion. I went for the tomato and thyme.   I came with 5 friends, one of whom ordered the pumpkin and sage pie, two the haggis and the other two chose a meaty version of the bangers and mash. A couple of people also ordered milkshakes. We are all very hungry but our food took quite a long time to arrive. My food finally arrived, a generous serving of mash with two veggie sausages on top. The gravy is served separately in little pots.  All in all, a relatively cheap meal which was comforting but also a little experimental introducing exotic flavours to a traditional dish. I was impressed to see quite a number of very different veggie options in a casual restaurant serving traditional fare.

eL7bU1JRgCHL0VomideRMw.text: The shakes are amazing so start off with that! The Reese peanut butter one and crackle one are good! I got the fish pie which was alright but my friends got the venison pie and another got the stake ale pie which was better! The pastry is freshly baked on top of the pie and is super crispy and flaky! The wait however was about 30 min and the service was slow but the waitresses had really fun attitudes!

f8qA1FtSgJuiXp2se2RpQQ.text: This is one of my favorite places to eat in Edinburgh!  I've eaten there probably around 10 times and have brought all my family and friends who have visited to eat there at least once.  I always get the same dish - 3 sausages with mash and gravy (completely gluten free!).  There's a huge selection of different sausages (they're all very high quality stuff) and the mash and gravy comes in a lot of different flavors too.  My favorites are the lamb and mint, the herby, and the pork and apple sausages, with the horseradish mash and the tomato and thyme gluten free gravy.  It's pretty reasonable prices - 8 pounds for the 3 sausages, mash, and gravy.  And if you're here for the festival, then it's very close to many festival locations.

w9fkLyaHIq8Erl-L0aCOJg.text: I love you Mum!   They are serious with their comfort food. Different options for sausages, mash, and gravy! All to warm your heart!

photos.caption: Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. From top right, clockwise: Haggis, Bangers and Mash, and Venison stew.

QGUX9yfnbozauxHCn5kRFQ.text: Good Scottish food. They are super friendly and make great food. Fantastic Vegetarian options. I have no idea how they make their Veg Sausage so good. Also a decent kids menu.   XOXOXO!

N_vctHoAfYRBqK2X9oI4fw.text: My wife wanted Steak Pie before we left Scotland and Mum's hit it out of the park. Fish and Chips were huge and well prepared. I highly recommend Mums. Small, intimate, great staff, good food and fun. This place is on my list for our next visit.

1z3AShubLq8ZiD1t1gvMWg.text: We ate at Mums on 10/23 and 10/25. The food was outstanding and we received excellent guidance in our choice of food and drink from Ricardo and (I believe) Muriel. The Guiness stew was awesome, as was my wife's Bangers and Mash. Best meals we had in Edinburgh! Truly comfort food. We'll be back!

OswCk4MMiAQmeW4s0nsDeg.text: Mums? Why have I never visited you before?  A fantastic lunch with Cressida F - we shared plates to expand the tastes. So I got to taste three diff types of sausages (Nom!) and two different types of mash (Nom! Nom!)  I also caved and ordered a milkshake after watching Cressi drink hers for 20 minutes. It was delicious!  The service was excellent. Such enthusiasm with the menu was infectious and I wanted to try everything!  Glad to visit and looking forward to the next time. :)

vZVTMl3QHggXi-Eh2HJShA.text: I thoroughly enjoyed my dinner at Mum's. I was in the mood for good old comfort food and ordered a burger was pretty much about the size of my face. It came with home-made wedges and a side salad and I opted to top it with blue cheese. And it was goooooood.   The other half went for sausages and mash, one of the signature dishes on the menu. You can choose your sausages, mash and gravy options so it's very personalised and fun.   The banana split was lovely. The chefs had caramelised the banana and there were three different flavours of ice cream, topped with more cream and chocolate and sprinkles. Good times. The portion size was ample to share.  Atmosphere was warm and happy - lots of people out for their dinner, good tunes over the speakers and really friendly waiting staff who were always keen to help even though it was mega packed.  Lastly, a thumbs up for the loos, which had brilliant black and white murals of popular culture icons like James Bond and Mrs Peel. Win!

TaIOHIP8JSyLh_v3Qyv3Mg.text: Mums is a fun place to eat. The food is solid and the staff are super friendly. I went with a large group, and we had to split up to fit into the tables. The stag made this really enjoyable because they ran messages back and forth between the two tables.  They put a lot of effort in to make sure we had s good time for dinner. Great food, perfect for groups and families, and an overall fun and memorable place to go!

1ji19HBHNa7NXnojoSSVQA.text: The bangers and mash were really good. Just the different selections of sausage and mash alone are amazing. The pies are really good as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Bangers &amp; Mash
Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

QkDHJ_k7EFSs1er-5Enf0w.text: Good food, but I was expecting a bit more. We were looking for something cosy and tasty as it was very cold and we've been whole day outside. We went for a mash with sausage and gravy, and macaroni cheese. Coke was tasting like water and food were bit bland and tasteless. Overall good atmosphere, really nice staff and funky toilets but I wouldn't be happy if my mum cooks like that.

rlggYNrL4NnHVuELqsAtgA.text: A great little spot away from the touristy Royal Mile.  Good home cookin', classic cartoons, friendly service and a great music play list.  Eat in or take away.  Breakfast was extremely satisfying - the Classic breakfast was classically good.  The local sausage was yum, as was the bacon, blood pudding and everything else on my plate.  The eggs with smoked salmon was also very good.  The best part: a wonderful cup of coffee with warm milk - done perfectly from their espresso machine.  Service was friendly, but a bit slow.  Would like to return for lunch.  Give this place a try, you won't be disappointed!!  No frills but fun atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Mums interior view
Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. What the?
Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Good comfort food

Udw3rVTzWoZfVcG5fOdZRA.text: Stopped in for breakfast this morning before our train left. The servers were nice and attentive. The food was just ok. The pancakes were burnt and the bacon was undercooked.  I would find somewhere else for breakfast next time I'm in town.

WMychfaxOPRWSKkPEyvbJA.text: Mums was a nice little spot in Edinburgh just near grey friars graveyard. The place is a cozy little American style get down. They serve a traditional English breakfast as well as pancakes. Simple menu, but pretty solid. The short stack came with pancakes and some really good bacon. English restaurants tend to serve the bacon a little too undercooked for my taste, but this bacon was just right! My fiance got the traditional English breakfast. The Haggis was actually fairly tasty with a cinnamon raisin flare.      On top of the food was the service. The waitress was one of the nicest servers we have ever had. She shared cool things and ideas for us to see and do in Edinburgh to try and get off the beaten path. We'd return our next visit to Edinburgh.

TFeqe0YOSbRq6Y0fXd4FbA.text: Nothing outstanding except the service----Convenient location---pancakes were really really thick and chewy in the middle, not what we're used to in the states.

photos.caption: Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Full breakfast minus the yucky stuff (eggs and black pudding)
Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Heavy stuff
Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Really thick pancakes

hLGYXiR38Vf2_jjztV2BOA.text: This place is not going to win any culinary awards. It's basic comfort food. And they 5 star nailed it on comfort food. What more can you ask for than a place that does what it sets out to do, doing it to perfection.  If you want a fancy breakfast or a lot of options, look elsewhere. If you want a great diner vibe with personality (love the wall art and door posters on the restroom), great service that feels like home and makes you laugh, and the fattiest stack of no frills, straight up buttery syrupy bacon-y goodness that a stack of bacon pancakes could possibly muster... Look no further.  Best no frills, diner style comfort food I've had in a long time.

aoB6SWsXJLq59Sotntx_9A.text: Warm wine.  No meat in the pie only veg. Under cooked chips. Braw veggie sausages tho

pX2n1nODXg3AUkJtd0dxlQ.text: We had sausage & mash and fish & chips. The food was good, but the service was atrocious. Both waiters who serviced us were rude, abruptly cut us off multiple times, and the kitchen took a very long time.

Msoj4Hk9-qet6yHlnqkhLA.text: The pies here are amazing! The chicken and venison pie are a couple of favorites. It's a bit in the more expensive side but you're going to be more than full. Occasionally they hold a great 7 lunch deal.  I always recommend Mum's to anyone visiting Scotland or the Uk in general. This place really shows how to do good British comfort food.  The downside would be the breakfasts. They have really good breakfast but it's expensive and the portions are small. I was disappointed with the pancakes and eggs Benedict. However, their veggies is big and a not so bad deal.   Come here for lunch or dinner but maybe not for breakfast.

AkNynM1GGmlItl3ROIoLKQ.text: As awesome as I remembered it! The hospitality and good humor here are legendary. The pies and sausages are great as well. Delicious Scottish comfort food served by wisecracking, consummate hosts. Thank you!

O5htMzCVS-cr1Og8zZxX-g.text: Awesome cafe, with friendly staff and delicious comfort food.  This cafe seems to a local favorite, as it was very busy both times we visited, but the staff if friendly and even took time to visit with us.  Mums serves up comfort cafe food, and the favorite seems their bangers and mash.  Daily specials for bangers were available and served hot of a pile of mash potatoes.  Great place for a good meal and gathering place for friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Bangers and Mash
Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Front of Mums
Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Inside Mums

TmOiq7od0USv5YUw2XkiuQ.text: Excellent sausages especially the pork and chive with cheese and onion mash. A tradition for me and my partner every time we come here. Never had a bad experience in 7 years.  Also do a really tasty breakfast!

photos.caption: Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Buttermilk pancakes with maple syrup and bacon!

NbblSteSMdj5_cijKgO7pw.text: I arrived into Edinburgh really early in the morning so I thought I'd do something I never do- go out for breakfast! I'm so glad I did! First of all, I got a really warm welcome when I came in. I sat down and saw the most beautiful breakfast option one can ever see- eggs benedict! So I ordered that and a tea. It was absolutely delicious. Now as for service- the girl who was working was amazing! So perky and happy! Then when she found out I was visiting Edinburgh, she got me a map and made loads of cool suggestions about what I could do, even drawing how to get there! I did take her advice on one of the walks, as it was an unseasonably warm and sunny day for Edinburgh. A great experience from start to finish! I'll be back next time I'm in Edinburgh for sure!

FXOZHn2uaToJPBqgMUQ2mQ.text: You know what, mums is a place I always end up returning to when my family comes to visit. Why? Because it's simple, good value, welcoming and has a simple menu that everyone can get something they like. It's good home style cooking, with no pretentiousness at all.  Mainly though, I come back because they only seem to employ the nicest folk on the planet. Every single time I have been in to eat, the staff have been so lovely and chill. They seem to know when you want a wee chat and a giggle or if you need left alone to ponder life and existence.   A good all rounder, family friendly down to earth place. Recommended.

qs-M1hx9vAuVg3qrT95wsw.text: I came to mums after reading that they had some affordable local comfort food. And I will say that the food was affordable. The portions were decent and the staff were all super cool and friendly. They were quick to offer recommendations and open to chat. I think that they're definitely the saving grace of the establishment. That and the campy, oldies music.   The food was filling, certainly, but somewhat lacking in flavor. The steak and ale pie was slightly bland. I might return for a light lunch to try something else on the menu, but my dinner wasn't convincing.

S-YVXo4F2UB3LNGKWT021Q.text: Love the place and the people that work there!! My favorite is the shepherd pie and the sider!! Great food and atmosphere!!! A must see while in Edinburg!!

ytScYvHnWrARkDMulkZfbg.text: Did not like it at all....  one girl very rude and sarcastic. Not a very relaxing place.  Ordered coke and sausage an mash.  Quite nice nothing major.  She came with the coke and just slammed it down in front of me.  Would have been nice if it was Scottish staff.  Would not go again can  cook better at home.

5nhY3iAd_Kk5xCL1aOGSmg.text: Great comfort food said the poster on the wall. And it was. It was a dreich day and we all wanted some comfort food. Mum's delivered it by the bucket- load. Quality retro dishes that brought back memories. Childhood favourites on the drinks list - who doesn't remember ice cream floats from their childhood. Awesome drink & dessert combo.  I had the Spanish chorizo bangers with champ mash & onion gravy. The sausages were packed with chunks of chorizo, full of flavour & meaty goodness. The mash was buttery, lump free and I liked the crunchy sweetness of the spring onions that were mixed through.   I opted for a strawberry milkshake to wash it all down. It was the stuff of childhood. Thick, creamy and satisfyingly sweet. In a proper sundae glass too.   Most of the group had bangers and mash too. One had the steak pie & declared it as good as her nan's. must be good then. Who doesn't love their nan's cooking.  It was huge too. See the pic.  Let's not forget the sweeties. The bill comes with fruit salad & blackjack chewie sweeties. We fought over the fruit salad ones as noone wanted black teeth for the afternoon meetings.   All in, a lovely meal delivering comfort as advertised. At a reasonable price. We'll definitely be back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Huge steak pie
Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Strawberry milkshake

hsZ6mXajpObwhy9dA7MvDw.text: Rough and tumble, simple, homely, the definition of a greasy spoon (but the spoons aren't actually greasy).  Large portions of classic comfort food. Hilariously posed poster on the wall of an overgrown man and a large, matronly, mum-like lady serving him a giant plate of mash. Not the most beautiful or charming space, but it doesn't need to be.  As a vegetarian I was very impressed by the choice of two types of veggie sausage and a large range of mashes and meat-free gravies. We ordered the mushroom Wellington as well: everything was satisfying and homely.  There was something wrong with my coffee, but oh well.  Are there charming spaces with yummier food? Yes. Will they cost a little more? Probably. But will Mum's do? Absolutely. A solid four stars.

blaz8S0ul0viupLhRVZpMA.text: I came here almost every day I was visiting Edinburgh. Great veggie sausage.. all of the food was great! I think they had the best breakfast food I had in all 18 countries I visited last summer. Good cider too!

xNoD_0yG3wMq9t_wfdf6Cg.text: Now that I'm nearly done with the school semester & assignments, I can focus on more important things... like YELPING!   Mums is an awesome little breakfast joint and I think it was my favorite meal in Edinburgh. Wake up Sunday morning... what do we want? Breakfast. Got there at 9:50AM and it looked closed :(... luckily for us, they opened at 10. We were the first customers through the door and we were happily greeted by the coolest server ever. I ordered eggs benedict, which weren't as good as the ones I've had in the states, but the pancake stack... OMG... Thin pancakes, bacon slices in between , maple syrup. Holy crap, it was delicious. It was also so pretty I didn't want to eat it... and then, they were so good and our table devoured it. I also don't know what they put in the coffee here. It's freaking amazing and they actually give you a HUGE mug of it, not that little espresso cup crap.   Mums, thank you. You made my day! Food was great and service was top notch!

photos.caption: Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Pancake stack
Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Eggs Benedict

050LV8_pZeB8aTQVM5wsng.text: British home-cooked style meal. Comfort food. Enormous portions.  Delish soup, beef pot pie and chips.

nx48xN2iYGZB-EKbaRNZgQ.text: Peter Sellers once recorded a song with Sophia Loren that went something like this, "No wonder you're so bony Joe, and skinny as a rake. Well then, give us a bash at the bangers and mash me mother used to make".   When you're far (or not so far!) from home, and just want something to make you feel all warm and fuzzy inside, like your mothers bangers and mash, Mums is the place you should make a beeline for!  It's fairly straightforward, pick your choice of a variety of sausages, mash and gravy...then enjoy it with a great big smile on your face! For me it was the veggie sausage, with chipotle and cheese mash (good kick to it without being over-spicy!), and caramelised onion gravy! You can have 2 (6.95) or 3 (8.95) sausages depending on how hungry you are. I plumped for 2 so I could leave room for pudding!  The puddings were equally heart-warming, with my yummy apple and berry crumble tasting just like the crumbles I used to have at home (complete with a jug of delicious custard!)  To accompany my meal I had a boozy milkshake, and was absolutely overjoyed to find they stock one of my favourite things...Tequila Rose Liqueur. It made for a delightful strawberry milkshake with a hit of tequila!   Mums also have a good selection of other comforting dishes on the menu which are well worth a look!  I had a lovely meal here, and the staff were chatty, friendly and attentive. Word of advice though, book in advance if you have your heart set on a meal full of cuddles and fuzziness. They were full up and turning people away...and it's too wonderful a place to miss out on!

TS-3Omv5UVEZZ1SodE7LwQ.text: Cheap and cheerful, although I'm not sure if they're still doing the five-quid lunch special (soup and a main for a fiver -- solid!).   Good ale and cider selection. If they have Thistly Cross ginger cider, try it -- it's a cheeky dance party in your mouth!  The haggis stack is amazing and comes with delicious gravy. The sausages, although small, taste delicious and there are usually four or five varieties to choose from. Be forewarned, though, if you arrive after 1 or 2 p.m. they may have sold out of the most popular! Choose from about a billion types of mash and gravy and you're set.  I'd like to give Mum's five stars -- this review is really closer to 4.5 -- but their service can be a bit spotty at times. Staff are very friendly and nice but it's taken me fifteen minutes after seating just to get a drink order, so if you need a quick in-and-out lunch this might not be the place. Do go and linger though -- it's an adorable place and the food is so good you won't want to rush.

GtmVBxGtYIOSkteSp1F7QQ.text: Varieties of Bangers and Mash; what could go wrong?  I love the staff here, chatty and friendly but don't get in the way, and very kinda to my son and gave him a free sweety (ok we all got them with the bill but it was a lovely gesture!)  There are also great breakfast options here, the black pudding roll I had was fab too.  Things are simple at mums, but its tasty and affordable. good job!

z6UOEUVilwdfLBFNbxLEUg.text: This restaurant was conveniently located behind the National Museum of Scotland and it wasn't crowded at all. I tried the sausages and mash (Mum's herby pork) with caramelized onion gravy and garlic and mushroom mash. It's really nice that you can choose from so many flavors of mash, sausage, and gravy. The mash was lovely. The sausages were actually less yummy than I expected. My husband had a burger with fries (chips). I thought his burger was dry and not very good. The chips were just so-so. I'd avoid the burgers. But the prices here are generally reasonable and portions very filling. I'd like to come back and try more of the menu.

F6s1TuM3lRWBYz_njDi3iQ.text: The sausages and mash are a good.  The chorizo was my favorite.  Did not care for the steak and ale.  Felt that it was a bit dry.   I also had fish pie which was OK, but I found it light on fish. It was a mixture of salmon and some white fish.  i thought the sausage was a better bet.   Service was very friendly and welcoming, yet laid back.  Likely a student hangout since it's near the university.  Affordable prices for basic comfort food.  I would and did go back again.

KreaVYC0RlDfQZup9bMGZg.text: I have nothing bad to say about Mum's.  If I was FORCED to it might be that it can take a little longer to get your food than you might expect at such a small informal place.  But who cares, it's delicious, and it's cheap.  They have a  rotating selection of homemade sausages and always have a Vegetarian option.  You can pick anything you like, with any type of mash you like, and with any type of gravy you like.  So many options and everything I had there was great.  Mums is one of my favorite places in Edinburgh.

1Xyd3Zm_RLJuseunt4u4iw.text: Hurricane BawBag  2.00pm.  8th December 2011.  450 words into Linguistics essay.  72 hours to go for essay.  5 hours until bourbon tasting.  Need stomach lining. Need warmth. Don't need hail in my eye. Got hail in my eye.  Need restaurant. Don't care where. Don't care what. Hungry. Cold. Wet. Cranky (ok, Bitchy). Want coffee. Want bread. Want to whine.   But I can't. Cause where did we end up? Mum's. The cutest lil' coolest lil' diner type joint this side of Newington! And how!   Now, any chance at keeping to my diet of celery and green tea was OBLITERATED when I walked through the door. There was nothing but chips and cheese and potatoes and gravy and pies and cakes and sausages and Wellington's and... happiness, did i mention they serve happiness here? Well they serve it with a teeny doggie back of guilt and regret, but happiness is what you'll get.   But who could say no to the staff? I couldn't. The waitress was the bee's knees and I just enjoyed every chattable minute! The place was practically empty so a little extra sweet talking and friendliness when you can - don't mind if I do!   I had the Mushroom Wellington, and everyone else got some sort of cheesy heavenly flaky delight ,roast chicken pot pie and macaroni cheese...  [which is a thing we need to discuss in further detail Scotland - macaroni cheese implies that it's cheese with macaroni on it. yes. the first noun modifies the second. grammar rant over]  can't say i'll be back early and often because well...  I wasn't hungry for like 2 days.   BUT I will be back absolutely:  1. when i miss my mom 2. when i run a marathon 3. when i break up with someone 4. when i bomb an exam 5. when i have pms 6. when i'm in a bad mood  Plenty 'o' reasons to come back =)

9wRhEgv57-917TVP-3i-_w.text: Home cooked food doesn't necessarily mean it will be good. I assume the person at home still has to be a good cook.  All the food here was pretty bad. Cheap and frozen, It's a bit like their mum did actually go to Iceland.   The staff were a bit bizarre too. Really quite unhelpful.

X35jr5qhK5D8So4lwwC6oA.text: Well Mum's Great Comfort Food certainly lived up to it's name! We were instantly greeted by an unbelievably friendly member of staff full of great chat.   The menu is great, the main dishes are burgers, bangers and mash and pies. You get to choose which mash you want from a huge list such as red onion and basil, cheese and onion, leek and bacon etc.  My only advice would be don't eat for 2 days before you visit. I ordered the steak and ale pie with black pudding and apple mash and when it arrived i was shocked by the enormity of it. It really was enormous. This could be a bit off putting for some people but luckily i was starving. The pie was delicious and i couldn't fault it, but the mash was a bit disappointing. To be honest it seemed a bit more like instant mash.  Overall i loved this place. The staff are amazingly friendly and love to have a good chat with everyone, and the food is certainly very comforting! I can't wait to go back!

ndHlTMUa-OjYwiGiV_SbBA.text: Comfort Food on the Cheap!    My wife had their Bangers and mash with two of their "custom" Sausages for that day (Horstradish + Beef). I had their standard Hamburger and Chips. The Chips are actually fresh cut vs. the frozen rubbish you get in a lot of places. For what it is, it's amazing and just as it's billed: "Comfort Food".  Ambiance is that of a diner, can get a bit noisy at times.  Sheppard's pie = amazing as well.

EPfyEqxEJecIvJFwQ-obyg.text: I absolutely LOVE Mums. Comfort food all the way.  I came here first as a tourist (back when it was Monster Mash) years and years (and years and years..oh my...) ago and I won't say that it is the reason I moved here, but it's high on the list.  Bangers and Mash is an obvious favourite. The selection of custom sausages changes daily and there's a wide selection of mashes and gravies, who knew ordering bangers and mash could be so complicated!  If that's not to your taste then something on the extensive (ish) menu of good, warm, stodgy food should take your fancy.  As for your surroundings, Hong Kong Phooey on the telly and booths will summarise everything you need to know. The staff are always full of banter and are a complete joy. They'd brighten anyone's day!  To complete your meal, in lieu of mints, you'll receive a selection of Blackjacks and Fruit Salads with your very reasonable bill. There's also candy bracelets, though legend has it they're reserved for only very special customers/occasions!

zBzqvipGduGps-zQi4TiuQ.text: Fantastic little place. Doesn't look like much from the outside, but the food was fantastic and the service was as well. We had the lamb and mint sausage with bacon and leek mash and the flavor was incredible. My wife had the chicken and rosemary pie and was enough for two and was delicious as well. Worth the walk off the beaten path!!!

aH_bs0d_1JJzMgTLlBL55w.text: What is left to say about Mums. It has become my favourite start of each weekend, walking in and having a different combination of sausages of the day, accompanied with one of these delicious combinations of mash and gravy and eggs on top.   If you are in the mood for a burger or a pie you can't go wrong either - the beef is tasty as hell and the venison is also a delight. Pack these with a comfy and friendly atmosphere, waiters that don't hesitate giving you opinions about the dishes of each day and great prices and you have it; a place which is really as good as it gets.

PbkFnxLesseSvZJ13RFebA.text: So I finally made it to Mum's and I'm happy to report that it lived up to expectations.   Essentially you should know whether or not you're going to like this place from how it is advertised... it's a comfort food joint with a retro, almost diner type, edge... what you see is what you get so if the idea of a few sausages and mash doesn't do it for you then it may not be your kinda place.  (They do have some other mains, the haggis seemed a popular choice our particular day, but the sausages and mash are the primary stars.)   The good news is in the staggering amount of choice for said stars... I had a hard time trying to decide what to get, eventually going with the Mexican Hot (yum!) and a Pork, Garlic, and Thyme Sausage atop of a Mushroom and Garlic Mash with Caramelised Onion Gravy.  The Mexican Hot was excellent, definitely on my list to order again if it happens to be available... the Pork, Garlic, and Thyme Sausage was actually quite good, but probably the most like sausages I've had elsewhere... if you've ever gotten a Tesco Finest Pork & XYZ sausage, it was along those lines... no fault to them however, I really should have realised this from the name to be honest.  A friend of mine got the Beef and Guinness Sausage which was excellent and left me a smidge jealous. (Food envy is definitely a real thing!)  The mash was as described and quite good as well... I personally will work my way through another type next time, but out of curiosity as much as anything else.   The service was friendly, but just a tad slower than I would have liked... not slow enough to be called bad however, and when you were being attended to it was very personal and friendly which I adore.   The place itself works for what it is and eerily reminded me of somewhere you would find in Little Five Points, Atlanta... that's certainly not a bad thing, but it had made me wished I had dressed a bit cooler that particular day as each of the other customers pretty much looked like they could have been in a band and shamefully I was sans waistcoat this particular day.   They only have a few beers on tap, but the two choices we partook in that day were winners for us... one being the Thistly Cross Whisky Cider, which really caught the three of us off guard in how good it was, with the other being a Tempest Red Rye beer which was also extremely good, both complimenting the meals nicely.   We didn't have desserts, but what went by did look extremely good and despite not being able to have them (blasted lactose!), I really liked that they had milkshakes on the menu.   One of the best bits about this place to me is that the prices match the food... you're not going to pay an arm and a leg to eat here despite the "cool" factor.   As a last note for those that this applies to... they actually had several veggie sausages on offer as well, some of which seeming as adventurous in composure as their meaty counterparts, so don't be scared to stop in here with your meat hungry friends.  (Aside from that they had the compulsory Veggie Haggis as well should sausages not be your thing.)   So there you have it... good comfort food at good prices, some days you really couldn't ask for more.

abo-V9XqgQndGKrtBzL2LA.text: Sometimes it's neither the sights nor the monuments a city has to offer but the food and the delightful people. I had the friendliest server, Paulie, who served an amazing shepards pie and took the time to chat it up with me to make me feel at home in a city halfway across the world from me. It's a very cozy little joint with the best service (especially considering it is not dependent on tips as I am used to!) I will definitely return to Mum's the day I return to Edinburgh.

8dfyaUT0pUpceZS7D0TxTg.text: I mourned the loss of Monster Mash on Glasgow's Byres Road, but I think I prefer Edinburgh's branch even more!  Monster Mash specialise in good old comfort food, enough to keep you warm on a cold winter's night. Priding themselves on offering traditional British grub, their simple, stodgy offerings are quite refreshing compared to the bland gloss of many restaurants nowadays. With a crackling radio humming in the background,much of the kitchen in plain view and a cosy gathering of intimate, chipped formica tables that give you the sensation you're leaning, cafe's like Monster Mash have become charming since there aren't enough of them these days.  There is an element of nostalgia as you are lovingly served up a massive pile of steaming mash and taters, and the attentive waiters are always on hand to make sure you are suitably well fed. It's very down to earth and the menu is kept short and very sweet, so you won't be bamboozled by fancy options.   It's the kind of place you can turn up in jeans to unabashedly stuff your face. In fact, the caring bunch at Monster Mash encourage you to leave your finest attire on the coat hanger, your feigned etiquette at the door, and just to come as you are. They want you to eat and be merry, making Monster Mash the best place in Edinburgh to get some of the finest rustled up scran in the city.

photos.caption: Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

C0j0PTPF8FcdlluVbMEdug.text: Been hearing about this place for some time. I *want* to love it but the service is a bit patchy. The food was nice. Lovely, in fact, and locally sourced which is awesome. The prices are on the high side for what you get. I had veggie sausage with chipotle and cheese mash. 7 quid and not a vast portion, either. I ordered drinks and they never came. Had to get up and go find my waiter who was busy sending a very important text. I think this place has a great concept and obviously good cooks in the back. Sort out the front end service and you've got a winner. The kids menu is pretty great. Will go again. My friends had the pies and these were spectacular.

4GouxtbnqJNlh3A8BYIMlg.text: A great little spot just around the corner from the University of Edinburgh.   We had the winter veg soup, the haggis, and the venison and dumplings.   The haggis was absolutely the highlight. Served over mashed turnips and potatoes with some killer gravy. Venison was nice and flavorful although the dumplings were dense and the side veg were underdone.  They also have Brew Dog IPA on tap which was nice too see.  Friendly staff who really care about the food and making you feel welcome. Next time I'm back in Edinburgh I'm definitely stopping in at Mums.

ZQWF-CywYrk8cIdOFQWVFQ.text: Being from the southern United States where great comfort food can be found in delicious abundance, I wasn't sure what to expect from this place. I was greeted by a nice warm atmosphere and an incredibly nice staff. The place really does make you feel like you're at home. As I was looking at the menu there were so many dishes that caught my eye but then I saw the pumpkin and sage pie and I can never pass up anything with pumpkin in it. The pie itself was quite big and it also came with a side of vegetables and chips. The flavors of the pumpkin and sage went well together and neither overpowered the other. I went home stuffed as could be. This is a great place to go for some delicious comfort food and one I will definitely go to again.

MWaHPiBv3sU9ijbv6fDFew.text: The one place that everyone kept telling me to go to in Edinburgh, was Mums. I met another Japanese tourist who travelled to so many places, living through the states and Canada - but has never had bacon and pancakes, eggs benedict, or mac n cheese (which came with chips).  I needed to fix this.   So we shared those 3 items, with 2 teas, and it came to 10 each.  I wouldn't say it's the best quality food, but to have a decent hot meal for 7-8 I'm not gonna complain!  I really wanted to try the bAngers and mash (they have 14 kinds!), but didn't have time to revisit.   Anyway, we walked away happy and full :) great spot for a tourist looking to get a good value experience for bangers n mash, pies and stews, and haggis!

photos.caption: Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

gRN5kgL1V4Ya8mY0HPBlzw.text: Loved it! Just what us tourists wet looking for! The venison meat pie was probably the best thing I have had in all of the U.K.! We would have been happy to have taken all of our meals here!

photos.caption: Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

ZhzrAsd9QNIl1xr9nl_YTA.text: Choosing an item that you want to eat on the menu at Mums is like lining all of your children up and having to tell them which one your favorite is. Don't worry wee ones, I love all of you.  Mums has a selection that can't be beat. I finally decided on the venison and redcurrant pie and my girlfriend had chicken rosemary pie (both delicious). We are aching to return to try the unbelievable selection of different sausage and mash plates, burgers, and puddings. Not to mention everything is under 10 - perfect for poor Americans who spent all their savings to move here. The drinks all sounded amazing too (Irn Bru floats, for real) and went for around 3-4.  The service was excellent and our waitress was wonderful. She was funny, friendly, and so helpful. She explained things on the menu that we didn't understand without so much as an eye roll. You guys call zucchini "courgette"? What? Anyways.  The atmosphere was simple and a little cooky at times. Classic rock was the soundtrack to our gorging. We will be returning here many, many more times.

photos.caption: Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Finally, an opportunity to literally piss on the English.

u6T1Fsheom2xZ-9uE9fjvQ.text: Good food, but slow service and unorganized. I enjoyed the food here, I got the ham and chicken stew which was very good. It's located pretty conviently near the Scotish National Museum, so it's good for a quick lunch after that.

c1fnTYstEa4g-d4JV3WBGA.text: Food is very German . Flavor is en.... soso. And maybe I prefer food with boiling potato more than chips.

photos.caption: Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. I like cheese broccoli. Everything with broccoli I will try and suggest
Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Fish cakes. Cake.... cake...ok ... scotch style of cake. I think they are fried smashed potatoes
Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Soup for today. Strong flavor of paprika.

7b4v0ct3JdH0P5F3DmNWTw.text: This place might be my favorite! Lots of gluten free options. The sausages are great. Chipotle and cheese mash are amazing! I've also had some of the pies (venison one is very nice). Great cheeky and personable service.  The manager and staff are so helpful.  So thankful I found this place.

OiZP6Sv9B742QBWaXrdRkA.text: Not sure how this place garners such good reviews.  Worst burger.  Didn't even finish it.  And I love pretty much all burgers from gourmet to McD...and I was starving after spending several hours at the amazing National Museum.

ntzPL-RzNWIOkjVdwgOiUw.text: As advertised-- solid authentic comfort food. Would return for breakfast, but would avoid if terribly busy, service very slow but good worth the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Glorious full Scottish breakfast.
Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Banger that mysteriously came out separately.
Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Scottish salmon with soft scramble

dUV5PS8MpIoXzeB2ZUcHHg.text: The restaurants advertises its self as "comfort food" which it certainly is. I got the pumpkin/sage pie, husband got the sausage with mash. No complaints.

photos.caption: Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

wErY5c002Lts-tbhbufXrA.text: Must come here to eat.  There is something on the menu for the pickiest of kids.  The service couldn't have been any better with humor and sarcasm.  We enjoyed everything about it.

PZc-YJK3PggmgvVYrM6t-A.text: Hearty food at good prices, well served. Not maybe the first choice during the Summer months but last Sunday was a tad damp & chilly so this place drove away the chill with its good sized portions of sausage & mash with sides of mushy peas, topped off with warm chocolate tart & a couple of chocolate-including ice creams. A wholesome, no frills establishment for the whole family.

photos.caption: Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

1cILzniu7VsQmwuAyUv6CA.text: Great service, good prices, yummy food, and filling portions.  I had the Mums classic, which was alright (not really up my alley--I can't get past the idea of black pudding), but my friends both ordered the pancake stack, and it was AMAZING. Don't be an idiot--get it. Pancakes layered with bacon and drenched in maple syrup are a great idea.  Our server was also really helpful while ordering and saw how tired we were (red eye flight the day right after we graduated... bad idea) and brought us a complimentary order of tea to wake us up for the rest of our day. :)

PAacwLsL89zOmQeP1rQOqA.text: Eh. I would stop there but that would be 'shorter than normal reviews.'  The staff are great, and they get 3 stars.   The food is edible, but not cheap enough to justify eating there and dealing with it. We had eggs benedict and it wasn't nice- the hollandaise sauce was weird, the muffins were cheap, and I picked mostly fat from the bacon and got one bite of actual bacon.   Not worth it.

U2N1mkp5RON_RCro1rYuIQ.text: This place was pretty good. It's definitely comfort food, so it's heavy and kinda greasy, as expected. We started with the cauliflower cheese, which was really good. My friend is vegetarian, so she was really excited to see vegetarian bangers and mash on the menu. However, she was disappointed by the mash and gravy and said it tasted really stale; like it had been sitting out all day. I came literally for the mac and cheese and it was pretty good. I could've done without the chips it came with because they weren't really anything special, but the mac was creamy and did it's job. Nothing we had was particularly outstanding but it was decent and definitely comforting.

OcpqhB8GUM1Oz-Zlq7jebA.text: Great comfort food that any mum would make for a child!  Order sausages! Lamb and mint is the best! And the pie is also nice.  Overall me and my bro are happy with the food and the price! Reasonable price. Will def go back if we have a chance!

photos.caption: Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Pie

K1ETNZS_LDGG61-sJpoiMA.text: Came here for lunch, and it had a kind of diner/comfort food feel. Plenty of seating for groups of 2s or 4s. We had a group of 6, but they were able to seat us pretty quickly. My bf ordered their fish and chips, and I ended up having dessert for lunch --treacle and date pudding! The fish and chips were good, although I'm not a fan of mushy peas. My friends enjoyed their sausage and mash orders, and I loved my dessert! At first, I wasn't too sure about the choice, because I normally don't eat dates, and I was looking for more of a tart/pie. But the waitress recommended it, so I decided to try it out. I'm so glad I did! It was delicious, still warm, and very rich, so it paired nicely with the ice-cream. If you're looking for dessert at Mums, try the treacle and date pudding!

oh90Ie8uy4PlRTc90E3ycQ.text: OooOoOoOOOOoooo. Bangers and mash make me a happy lady. My tum is thanking me even now, eight hours later.  I came here for lunch with Sally L and between us we sampled the herby sausage, plain sausage, and one of the day's specials, a pork and ale sausage; chipotle mashed potato and cheese and onion mashed potato; and tomato gravy and caramelised onion gravy. Goodness me.  The sheer enthusiasm for the menu shown by our waitress, the delight she took in recommending her favourite dishes (the venison is a winner, apparently) and helping us to choose the best combination of sausage, mash and gravy was worth the fifth star in itself. But the food didn't let this down - super flavoursome, obviously good quality, and very hot. I had a chocolate milkshake, too, which was just as a milkshake should be; ice cream based, and thick enough to stand a straw in.  I'll be back for sure! I was having an iffy morning and lunch here was just what the doctor ordered to set me back on track and go into the weekend with my head held high! And my stomach held in my hands...

photos.caption: Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Got to have some veg for manners!
Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Cheese and onion mash with herby sausages
Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Chipotle mash with pork and ale sausage

i_UpRK3oMwsHfOUTHWl6Rw.text: Great experience! Scottish comfort food. I had a lamb and mint sausage and a beef and onion sausage. The lamb was delicious and the rest was good. Comfort food is a particular experience. Just like I don't like grits but southerners love it, I am not a big mashed potato fan. However, my boyfriend had the chipotle cheese mashed potatoes I believe and he loved them. Servers were fun and quirky but it was only two of them so the service was a bit slow. Great prices and a must do!

7LWJtl3oNiSjFieFoFJ6tg.text: Such a fun place. The food was amazing and worth the short wait. We sat with another couple from Italy so we could be seated sooner, and it was really nice.

lQpapfH1aq16aodvNkwVRQ.text: Not bad, really not... but also not in my book something to call 'amazing'...    Maybe I am spoiled but I like to think I just love my eggs benedict... and have had many all around the globe! It's my to-go-to breakfast as I find it hard to make it myself at home. Maybe I am comparing it too much to the real american diners, but even the ones I had in Costa Rica were lots yummier... The hollandaise sauce had a but too much sour flavour in it, not sure if its lemon or... it just didn't taste balanced.  Waitress was very friendly and patient with my mum (whom I HAD to take to a place with her name, right?) who speaks only a few words of English. I was lucky to be there at a calm moment, we were the one of the 3 parties in. But really nothing amazing or not a place I would want to go back to as soon as possible...

c68U2wH01BkL7HJ429UgbQ.text: On a cold day in Edinburgh, nothing sounds much better than some warm comfort food. I stopped in around 1:30pm and was immediately greeted and shown to a table. I went with two of the sausage-of-the-day selections (pork and leek, beef with onions and garlic) and the cheese and onion mash. For the gravy, I asked for a recommendation between the traditional brown and the caramelized onion - without hesitation, the server recommended the caramelized onion. "Every time," she said. So, I went with that.   Everything was outstanding - the flavors in the sausages and mash were so good that I hardly needed the gravy (though it was delicious, too). Service could not have been friendlier.   If you're looking for some traditional British fare, this is a great place to stop.

photos.caption: Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Sausage with cheese and onion mash, sautéed onion gravy. Delicious!

edWvifU6jfCOLNETgLfgHw.text: Traditional good in a casual setting with a young feel. Largely locally sourced. Perfect for a visitor to the city who wants traditional Scottish food. Really friendly wait staff.

WK73vsXbfPRjYa2AZK8vvA.text: Came in to grab a Proper breakfast upon our arrival into Edinburgh for Hogmanay, won't disappoint!

photos.caption: Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

3FrmoySx7Ar4Q5zCqkY3XQ.text: The Shepard's Pie was the perfect food to warm us up on a chilly Edinburgh day. The staff was really great and they played great music!

photos.caption: Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

g51__xMVR_qxIZwdMm4qNA.text: First things first: me and my boys were aggressively hungover for this meal. When we got their the waiter noticed and gave us a gallon pitcher of water. She hardly noticed when we each took turns yakking in the bathroom. The meal was cheap and smacked me back into sobriety. She also recommended sick places for us to go get sloshed again. Going back tomorrow.

maErMCWGZA7VtJw0RkFAeA.text: The absolute best treacle and date pudding I've ever had. Not too rich or sweet, and had a nice scoop of vanilla ice cream. I might be coming back tomorrow for seconds. Friendly service, fair prices, and big menu. They also have alcoholic milkshakes!

photos.caption: Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Treacle and date pudding. Delicious!!

86zXOTWMzwhQAS9CESpckw.text: It was my first time here. I loved how friend the staff was. She welcomed me in, and she found out i was a tourist, she immediately gave me a map of the city and gave me some recommendations. I really liked their coffee and the food was good too. I tried their shepherd's pie and it was very filling.

photos.caption: Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Sheperd&#39;s pie with an americano.

D4Ac8vyKGpYALb_nV85qVg.text: My husband and I had lunch here while we were visiting London, and it was a great experience. The staff was friendly, and the service was good. I had a shepherd's pie, and that was great (and super filling). The place was reasonably priced, and the atmosphere was laid back and not loud at all. Two thumbs up!

photos.caption: Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. They gave us a post card of their restaurant

xP5y4a7-IimPQcJ4DIin0g.text: Probably the best comfort food there is for a Scot! Well, me trying to be Scottish lol. Got the bangers and mash and they have different varieties of them and it was absolutely delicious. They probably though I was mad eating everything but it was just so damn tasty! The gravy was splendid. Everything was affordable. Good eats!

0U7m5lbFQAV65-XYj7-WDg.text: Ok so I'm not exaggerating but this is my favorite breakfast place of all time and I've been to a lot of breakfast places. A lot has to do with the staff- upbeat, friendly and welcoming. But mostly, the Scottish breakfast is just fantastic, even the vegetarian style. The veggie haggis was out of this world. Walked miles to eat it, and will do it again next week. The atmosphere is very casual and laid back but is full of charm. Come hungry, because the portions are huge and the prices are good. If I lived in Edinburgh and not Glasgow, I would leave at least ten pounds heavier and it be worth it. See you soon, mums!!

photos.caption: Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The veggie breakfast - outstanding

Hqf92nXMahyccESCavDssw.text: Good place to stop for breakfast before a long day of walking and exploring the Royal Mile and Victoria Street. My husband had a sausage roll and an egg roll. I had the salmon and eggs on muffins. Simple and delicious.

re2R2s6mtIfCy2YkqnloMg.text: We popped by our first morning in Edinburgh. We plan to come back every day.  The gravy was incredible. Bangers in mash have an awe inspiring number of combinations. The vegetarian options are all good - there is nothing "meh" about this restaurant. I wanted to dip the freshly made pie puff pastry in gravy and just have that for a full meal.  Service was personable and friendly. Prices were on point. I can only say good things.

Tl9Wr6ZUiTfX9Nx_m4Vc1g.text: First place I went to after my red eye to Edinburgh. Possibly the best customer service I have ever had. This trip was special for me as it was my first time ever having eggs benedict. Everything about Mums was excellent.

axh5P9XgpDajzO5iNykqfA.text: Oh. My. Goodness. I love this place!! Just went for the first time this past weekend, and I'm already craving another visit. It's such a comfy, down-to-earth environment, and the menu is soooo enticing. I wanted everything on it. Comfort food indeed! I ended up having the mushroom wellington, and I have zero regrets. It was DELICIOUS. And the chips/fries/whatever you call them were fantastic. And wow, I was actually full by the time I finished my meal! That's rare for me. Really cool. And the desserts are awesome, and the range of milkshakes available is drool-worthy... I'm getting hungry just thinking about it all.  PS: It's awesome for vegetarians; the person who brought me is one and calls this place a big favorite. :)

ILdtAPZ-8HtHWMnZMPHV8A.text: Save your appetite for another place.  Life is too short to waste a meal.  The food was average, however Scottish food is better at many other places.    Service was friendly and I REALLY wanted to love this place. Good food for the non-adventurous. Not so great for the price and taste. Not fine dining, but not they do have tables. If you don't mind standing, I would recommend a food cart instead.  If you want to sit pick another place. If you just landed on the shores of Scotland after being stranded on an island and want a starter meal to get your taste buds started again- - this is your place.   Not bad, not great. Truly average.

iwktHysKnM6Ys0hGH0WBIw.text: Comfort food.  That's what Mums serves. And they do it damn well.  Deep fried everything, including cheese? Yep, they've got that .Dishes served with a side of gravy? Yes please. Whiskies to warm your soul? Can I just live here?  The haggis was amazing. Sure, it was my first time (but it wasn't my last), and nobody did it better than Mums. If you're concerned about the taste, it's a lot worse on paper. Give it a shot and pay attention to all the flavors blending together. And of course, the gravy.  For my main, I had their special of the day, which was a game pie. I believe it was venison. Served in a gigantic flaky crust with chips and veggies on the side. It's something I want to eat every time it's rainy or snowy outside. Also, it was a TON of food.  But the best part of Mums? How inexpensive everything was. Definitely stop by if you're in Edinburgh!

W0MWeb2PiXA9Uu6eFmV3aw.text: Amazing food, staff and many Beanos for the kids.   Prices are very good. Came here 3 years ago and it was definitely on the tour list when we came back this year.  Very happy.

photos.caption: Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. A mug of MUMS

OBhTZ9by4uioHUF21HuOzg.text: We were vacationing in Scotland from Canada, and attracted to the reviews promising classic comfort food.  We were not disappointed! Service was quick and friendly.  We each had different versions of bangers and mash - the authenticity of home made comes through.  Loved the gravy, but the sausages were the star of the show.  Great location just steps from the National Museum of Scotland.

WLoDqKEYdY1O7iBSsxAeCg.text: This is a delightful spot for a well priced, quick breakfast. He food is delicious and very reasonable while the pleasant as can be staff serves you. If you are in the area, this is a must do for breakfast or brunch

TOvrpUSInnF0lyzVx7_7UA.text: 1. The servers are SO friendly  2. The food is amazing If these two points haven't convinced you to try Mums already then I recommend you go find out how awesome it is for your self! I went in on a Saturday afternoon and they were swamped. A server recommended that I try again in 20 minutes. When I came back they were able to seat me right away. This isn't a fast in and out place and has the feel of a real mom and pop stop. On top of coming here to leisurely dine, their food is also amazing. I had the bangers and mash. For starters there are so many options to chose from just for this one dish! It was amazing how fresh the sausage tested. I ended with the cranchan. The comfort food here will send you straight into a coma.

photos.caption: Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Bangers and mash. 1 pork and leek sausage, 1 beef and garlic sausage, leek and bacon mash all topped with caramelized onion gravy
Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Whiskey cask aged cider
Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Cranchan

6n_StBQFKL1pZOO1WR66lQ.text: What a nice surprise, especially after enduring that really dumb Camera Obscura exhibit.  I had mushroom wellington pastry over mash potatoes and my son had delicious sausages also over mash.  Probably deserves 4.5 stars but certainly more than 4.  Great waitress pushed this up to a 5. :)

Rz_OetwJ5sQxD6LCQTl-Eg.text: The food and service at Mum's was great, but the seating was a little claustrophobic, which is why I'm giving this a 4/5.   On our first day in Edinburgh, we dropped into Mum's because we were craving something hearty, comforting, and traditional (I especially wanted to try haggis as soon as possible). There are like 2393472847249 restaurants to choose from near Edinburgh's Old Town, and honestly, we chose this one because it appeared on a few "best of" lists online.   The restaurant isn't small by European standards, but because it was pretty busy, it felt small. We were seated at a table near the back, which was pretty dim despite it being the middle of the day (you can tell by the poor lighting in my food photos). Next to us, were seated a group of young women who appeared to know each other from one of the hostels nearby. That being said, this place definitely caters/appeals to travelers/Americans.   Our server was pleasant, quick, and able to explain the menu items to us. No complaints at all.  I ordered the haggis from the "Starters" portion of the menu, to kick things off. For those that don't know, haggis is Scotland's traditional dish and it's made with ground up sheep/calf organs, spices, oats, and other things. I was hesitant as hell about trying this, but it smelled pretty good and was plated beautifully, on a bunch of mashed potatoes and other veggies. It also came with a gravy boat. I immediately poured gravy all over mine, which was kind of a mistake as I found the gravy to be overpowering and salty. The haggis, however, was pretty good, especially when eaten with the veggies. It's got a very unique and strongly-spiced flavor that I honestly can't compare to anything else. Just try it. Order one for the table and let everyone take a bite.   Since I ordered something so unusual for me as a starter, I went with something I knew I'd love for my main dish - a vegan pumpkin and sage pie. The pies come in regular/large sizes and I'm glad I got a regular, because my friend ordered a large-sized one and it was HUGE. As a pumpkin/squash fanatic, I was all about this pie. It was flavorful, hot, and comforting. The pastry was crispy and delicious. I'm not vegan and I was very pleased.  The pie was served with peas and carrots, which were pretty bland, but that seems to be the UK standard. I love those veggies anyway, so I ate them all. Also, chips (french fries) because everything in the UK comes with a side of chips. At this point in my trip, I realized that the chips at basically every place I went to look and taste pretty much the same. I don't know if they all use the same frozen chips supplier?  Finally, I had to try one of their sausages. I wish I could remember which one I ordered, but it was on their specials menu (there were three options). I asked the waitress to pick her favorite, and she did. I know it was pork-based and really delicious.   Anyway, a good place to drop in if you're in the area. I wouldn't go again, just because I'd rather try one of the other bazillion restaurants that maybe appeal more to the locals.

photos.caption: Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Side of sausage - this was one of the specials of the day, can&#39;t remember, but it was delicious!
Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Pumpkin and sage pie (vegan)
Photo of Mums - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Haggis starter
